item.title: Aviva Investors 关闭唯一一家美国办事处，芝加哥再遭重创
item.description: Aviva Plc 的资产管理部门计划关闭其唯一的美国办事处，将重点放在英国本土以及加拿大的实际交易地点。【原文：Aviva Plc’s asset-management arm plans to close its only US office, focusing on its home country of the UK as well as Canada for physical trading locations.】

item.title: 中国恒大因欠款面临清盘申请
item.description: 中国恒大集团（Evergrande Group）旗下一家公司因未支付 2 亿元人民币（约合 2790 万美元）投资款及相关利息而成为清算申请的目标。【原文：A China Evergrande Group unit has become the target of a liquidation petition over an unpaid investment of 200 million yuan ($27.9 million) and related interest.】

item.title: 布雷万的主要对冲基金在两天的动荡中扭亏为盈
item.description: 本月的市场动荡帮助布雷万-霍华德资产管理公司（Brevan Howard Asset Management）的旗舰对冲基金扭转了此前的亏损局面，实现了全年盈利。【原文：This month’s market turmoil has helped Brevan Howard Asset Management’s flagship hedge fund swing to a profit for the year after reversing earlier losses.】

item.title: 纳米比亚称仅有 42% 获批采矿项目正在运营
item.description: 纳米比亚表示，该国批准的采矿项目中只有不到一半在运营，这促使政府在发放许可证时采取更强硬的立场。【原文：Namibia said less than half of the mining projects it has approved are in operation, prompting the government to take a tougher stance on issuing permits.】

item.title: 欧洲央行行长雷恩认为近期市场波动反应过度
item.description: 欧洲中央银行管理委员会成员奥利-雷恩认为，近期全球股市的动荡是一种 "过度反应"。【原文：Recent turbulence in global stock markets was an “overreaction,” according to European Central Bank Governing Council member Olli Rehn.】

item.title: 波兰计划斥资数十亿兹罗提改造民防
item.description: 在俄罗斯入侵乌克兰之后，波兰正准备斥资数十亿兹罗提用于民防，因为这个欧盟国家正在加强其能力。【原文：Poland is preparing to spend billions of zloty on civil defense as the European Union nation ramps up its capabilities in the wake of Russia’s invasion of Ukraine.】

item.title: 企业抢滩高等级市场，Meta 启动债券销售
item.description: Meta Platforms Inc. 是周三第一个进入美国投资级市场的公司，因为借款人希望利用一级市场的优势，而一级市场在周一的剧烈波动关闭了发行窗口后被大开。【原文：Meta Platforms Inc. was the first to tap the US investment-grade market Wednesday, as borrowers look to take advantage of a primary market that was left wide open after Monday’s volatility slammed shut the issuance window.】

item.title: 埃塞俄比亚中央银行通过特别拍卖向银行出售美元
item.description: 埃塞俄比亚国家银行向商业贷款机构出售美元，以缩小官方汇率和平行汇率之间的差距。【原文：The National Bank of Ethiopia sold dollars to commercial lenders as it seeks to close the gap between official and parallel exchange rates.】

item.title: 日本伊藤忠收购交易商 Javelin Global Commodities 的股份
item.description: 日本贸易巨头伊藤忠商事（Itochu Corp. ）收购了 Javelin Global Commodities 公司的少数股份。【原文：Japanese trading giant Itochu Corp. has bought a minority stake in Javelin Global Commodities, the historically coal-focused firm that’s fast expanding into oil, metals and renewables.】

item.title: 肯尼亚立法者建议对生活必需品实行价格管制
item.description: 肯尼亚一名立法者提议立法恢复对一些主食和药品的价格控制，以应对该国正在经历的生活费用危机。【原文：A Kenyan lawmaker proposed legislation to reinstate price controls for some staple foods and pharmaceutical products for the nation that’s going through a cost-of-living crisis.】

item.title: 英特尔失去了华尔街的耐心，逆风不断增加
item.description: 在又一份灾难性的财报发布后，华尔街上对英特尔公司的看好者越来越少。【原文：After another catastrophic earnings report, Intel Corp. bulls are increasingly few and far between on Wall Street.】

item.title: Glencore 首席执行官认为钴供应过剩将持续两年之久
item.description: 全球第二大钴矿商 Glencore Plc 表示，由于新增产量超过需求，市场供过于求的局面可能会延续到 2026 年。【原文：Glencore Plc, the world’s second-biggest cobalt miner, said oversupply in the market may stretch into 2026 as new output overwhelms demand.】

item.title: 荷兰银行首席执行官因未提供离职解释而遭质询
item.description: 荷兰银行（ABN Amro Bank NV）首席执行官罗伯特-斯瓦克（Robert Swaak）上周辞职的决定，使这家荷兰贷款公司在一个积极的收益日黯然失色，因为投资者和记者向他提出了很多问题，而他基本上都回避了。【原文：ABN Amro Bank NV Chief Executive Officer Robert Swaak’s decision last week to resign eclipsed a positive earnings day for the Dutch lender as investors and journalists peppered him with questions that he largely ducked.】

item.title: 特朗普的美国比特币储备计划惊动了没收专家
item.description: 唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）在竞选时承诺将美国政府持有的加密货币建立一个全国性的比特币储备库，这让前检察官们感到震惊，他们说，这将挪用被扣押的数字资产，而这些资产本可以用来补偿犯罪受害者。【原文：Donald Trump’s campaign promise to create a national Bitcoin stockpile with cryptocurrency held by the US government alarmed former prosecutors, who said it would divert seized digital assets that otherwise would be used to compensate victims of crime.】

item.title: 纽约时报》超出预期，新增 30 万数字用户
item.description: 纽约时报》公司公布的第二季度收益超出分析师预期，该公司的订户数量继续增长。【原文：New York Times Co. reported second-quarter earnings that beat analysts’ expectations, as the company continues to grow its subscriber count.】

item.title: 风暴德比致命— 因为它很慢
item.description:
两个天气系统阻挡了黛比的去路，使其能够在更长的时间内释放暴雨。【原文：

Two weather systems have been blocking Debby’s way, allowing it to unleash heavy rain for longer.

】

item.title: 布鲁克菲尔德资产管理公司利润增长，资产达到 1 万亿美元
item.description: 布鲁克菲尔德资产管理有限公司（Brookfield Asset Management Ltd.）公布季度利润增长，并称其管理的资产增至创纪录的约 1 万亿美元。【原文：Brookfield Asset Management Ltd. reported a gain in quarterly profits and said its assets under management rose to a record of approximately $1 trillion.】

item.title: 加拿大航空公司受机票价格压力影响利润下降
item.description: 加拿大航空公司报告称，由于竞争加剧和需求疲软，利润率受到压力，季度利润下降了 47%。【原文：Air Canada reported a 47% drop in quarterly profit as margins were pressured by more competition and softening demand.】

item.title: 美国抵押贷款利率跌至 6.55%，创两年来最大跌幅
item.description: 美国 30 年期抵押贷款利率上周创下两年来最大降幅，达到 2023 年 5 月以来的最低水平，并引发再融资申请激增。【原文：US 30-year mortgage rates plunged last week by the most in two years, reaching their lowest level since May 2023 and sparking a surge in refinancing applications.】

item.title: 迪士尼首次实现流媒体盈利，浏览量居首；乐园业绩令人失望
item.description: 华特迪士尼公司公布的第三季度业绩超出华尔街预期，流媒体业务首次实现盈利，电影业务扭亏为盈，抵消了主题公园的低迷表现。【原文：Walt Disney Co. reported third-quarter results that beat Wall Street estimates, with its first-ever profit in streaming and a turnaround in the movie business countering a sluggish performance at its theme parks.】

item.title: 据称亿万富翁阿达尼计划为旗舰项目筹资 12 亿美元
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，亿万富翁高塔姆-阿达尼（Gautam Adani）的旗舰公司正在考虑通过出售股份筹集约 1000 亿卢比（12 亿美元）至 1200 亿卢比的资金，此举将紧随其输电部门最近的另一项筹资交易。【原文：Billionaire Gautam Adani’s flagship firm is considering raising around 100 billion rupees ($1.2 billion) to 120 billion rupees through a share sale, according to people familiar with the matter, a move that would follow a separate recent fundraising deal at his power transmission unit.】

item.title: 开始一天生活所需的五件事美洲
item.description: 早上好。日本央行发出的鸽派信号为股市复苏注入了新的动力，而欧洲一些大公司发布的财报却令人失望。以下是交易员们正在谈论的话题。【原文：Good morning. Dovish signals from the BOJ give fresh legs to the recovery in stocks, while some of Europe’s biggest companies release disappointing earnings. Here’s what traders are talking about. — David Goodman】

item.title: 交易员抓住风险偏好脆弱回归的机会，债券下跌
item.description: 随着本周早些时候笼罩全球市场的恐慌情绪继续消退，美国和欧洲的政府债券纷纷下跌。【原文：Government bonds across the US and Europe fell as the panic that gripped global markets earlier this week continued to subside.】

item.title: CVS 再次下调业绩展望，启动 20 亿美元成本削减计划
item.description: CVS Health 公司股价下跌，原因是该公司连续第三个季度下调了 2024 年的盈利展望，并宣布了削减成本的措施，以在几年内节省 20 亿美元，因为医疗保健支出持续飙升。【原文：CVS Health Corp. shares fell as the company lowered its 2024 earnings outlook for the third straight quarter and announced cost-cutting measures to save $2 billion over several years as health-care expenses continue to soar.】

item.title: 英普拉茨公司减记 10 亿美元，将因价格下跌而报告亏损
item.description: 安派达铂金控股有限公司（Impala Platinum Holdings Ltd.）表示，即将公布的财报将包括198亿兰特（约合10.8亿美元）的减值，并警告称在铂族金属回落之后，预计全年将出现亏损。【原文：Impala Platinum Holdings Ltd. said its upcoming financial results will include impairments of 19.8 billion rand ($1.08 billion) and warned it’s expecting to swing to a full-year loss after platinum-group metals retreated.】

item.title: HPE 140 亿美元收购瞻博网络交易获英国反垄断法批准
item.description: 惠普企业公司斥资 140 亿美元收购瞻博网络公司（Juniper Networks Inc.【原文：Hewlett Packard Enterprise Co.’s $14 billion deal to buy Juniper Networks Inc. was cleared by the UK’s antitrust watchdog, paving the way for the firm to expand its presence in networking.】

item.title: 预订量和前景不及预期，Lyft 股价下滑
item.description: Lyft Inc. 公布的第二季度预订量和第三季度展望低于华尔街预期，导致该公司股价下滑。【原文：Lyft Inc. shares slid after the ride-hailing company posted second-quarter bookings and a third-quarter outlook that fell short of Wall Street’s expectations.】

item.title: 美国 10 年期国债拍卖收益率一年来首次低于 4
item.description: 最近几天，美联储迅速大幅降息的预期推动了债券反弹，在此之前，美国准备一年来首次以低于 4% 的收益率出售 10 年期国债。【原文：The US is poised to sell 10-year Treasuries at a yield below 4% for the first time in a year, after a bond rally in recent days that was fueled by expectations of rapid and large interest-rate cuts from the Federal Reserve.】

item.title: 史蒂文-姆努钦（Steven Mnuchin）说，是时候扼杀他创造的新国债了
item.description: 只要看一眼美国债券曲线，就会发现有些不对劲。有一种国债--20 年期国债--脱离了市场的其他部分。它徘徊在远高于其周围债券收益率的水平上。【原文：It only takes a quick glance at the US bond curve to realize something is off. One Treasury security — the 20-year — is detached from the rest of the market. It hovers at yields that are far higher than those on the bonds surrounding it — the 10-year and the 30-year.】

item.title: 非洲中央银行出手支撑下滑的货币
item.description: 非洲各国的中央银行正在加紧对本国市场进行不协调的干预，以支撑其下滑的货币，抑制输入性通胀。【原文：African central banks are stepping up uncoordinated interventions in their markets to prop up their slumping currencies and dampen imported inflation.】
